events.comment: For more examples and templates visit gametemplates.itch.io
By default the language of our app is english
Now attempt to load the language of our app from storage, if fail, we use the default which is english
Load language data from external event
Now change the text objects in the menu using the language data and app language
Now center each text on the screen as length of a text is different in different languages
Change menu text color to green when mouse is over
When settings button is clicked, go to settings page

In the main menu we have already loaded all language data in to a global structutre variable, so we don't need to load it again
Make sure you run the menu scene first
Highlight it with green the currently selected langage
Change title text to current language and position it to the center of the screen
Change select language option text to current language
Change back text to current language
Change text of each language option

Select language if clicked with mouse and change color of text to green to indicate selection
Also change value of AppLanguage variable and write language to storage to save selection permanently
Update all texts to current language
Change color of back text when mouse is over
Go back to menu when the back text is clicked

Language data (using google translate, sorry for any errors in translations)
using structure variables, so it works on all platforms that GDevelop support
We store all the language data in a global structure variable for simplicitiy so you can access any language data from any scene. 
However, in case you plan to support many languages and lots of texts, it may be not efficient as you may use lot of memory to store all the data even though you don't need them all. 
For example if you changed the language to French, you no longer need the data of all other languages but French until you change it again. 
The solution then is to store all this data in a scene structure variable in the settings scene and once you select the language, copy the text only of the selected language from the scene variables in to a global variable that you use in all scenes. This way you store the data of only 1 language at all times and not all the languages and you can save memory.
English
Hungarian - Magyar
French - Franais
Spanish - Espaol
